H0.text: Which British periodical was founded by Joseph Addison and Richard Steel in 1711, the current magazine bearing the title was launched in 1828. The Tatler

H1.text: Which British periodical was founded by Joseph Addison and Richard Steel in 1711, the current magazine bearing the title was launched in 1828. The Guardian

H2.text: Which British periodical was founded by Joseph Addison and Richard Steel in 1711, the current magazine bearing the title was launched in 1828. The Times

H3.text: Which British periodical was founded by Joseph Addison and Richard Steel in 1711, the current magazine bearing the title was launched in 1828. The Spectator

A4.text: Rintoul consciously revived the title from the celebrated, if short-lived, daily publication by Joseph Addison and Richard Steele.

A5.text: It was first published in July 1828, making it the oldest surviving magazine in the world.
